msContents.summary: This manuscript includes a Pañcarakṣā collection and a Saptavāra collection. The Pañcarakṣā "Five Protections" consists of the Mahāpratisarā, Mahāmāyūrī, Mahāsāhasrapramardanī, Mahāmantrānusāriṇī, and Mahāśītavatī (in various sequences). The earliest evidence for texts grouped together as the "Five Great Dhāraṇīs" comes from Tibetan catalogues around 800 CE, but this compendium is somewhat different from the surviving Sanskrit collection, which is preserved in manuscripts dating back to the eleventh century. These scriptures include spells, enumerations of benefits and ritual instructions for use. With the course of time all of them became deified and five related goddesses emerged. It is, however, important to note that the texts themselves do not have any references to these goddesses. The Saptavāra ("Seven Days") usually incorporates seven dhāraṇīs, the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdayā, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī/Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. This paper manuscript is probably to be ascribed to the 17th or 18th century. Instead of the Vasudhārā, the Saptavāra contained in this manuscript begins with the Vasudhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka.

msItem.title: Pañcarakṣā
msItem.incipit: [1v1] evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān_ || vajameruśikhalakūṭāgāre vi[1v2]harati sma || tad idāni pravakṣā%mi bhūtasaṃghā śṛṇotu me || % namo buddhāya || namo dharmāya || na[1v3]mo saṃghāya || namaḥ sarvatathāga¦%tānāṃ namo namaḥ || sarvvabu%ddhabodhisatvebhya || buddhadharmmasaṃ¦[1v4]ghebhya ||

supportDesc.condition: Complete, in generally good condition. Many folios look dirty or stained. The writing is often faded, and sometimes illegible.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 45 akṣaras per line.
layout.stringHole:
Two square blank spaces, framed by double marginal lines.
2 2

list.item: On the inner side of the back cover, a note, possibly bearing the number of folios.

bindingDesc.p: Wood cover, original binding (with floral motives).

history.provenance:
Presented by Mrs. E.K. Waterhouse Waterhouse, E. K.
in 1957.
